item.title: Installing Linux on Thinkpad X120e
item.description: Solution: When installing any linux flavour that uses Calamares to Thinkpad X120e, flash USB with rufus. Set partition scheme to MBR and target system to BIOS or UEFI. In the BIOS config settings in the laptop, set UEFI/Legacy Boot to Both, and set UEFI/Legacy Boot Priority to Legacy First. Uncheck install third party software and choose Erase disk and install. https://www.learningpenguin.net/2018/07/13/fix-grub-efi-amd64-signed-package-failed-to-install-into-target/ https://www.learningpenguin.net/2018/07/13/fix-cannot-boot-after-installing-linux-mint-in-uefi-mode/ How I got there: Researched which flavour of Linux to go with.
